00048   class Atom {
00049   public:
00050 
00051     // Be careful that we don't overflow an unsigned long!
00053     enum bits {
00054       nullbit = 0,
00055       coordsbit = 1,
00056       bondsbit = coordsbit << 1,
00057       massbit = bondsbit << 1,
00058       chargebit = massbit << 1,
00059       anumbit = chargebit << 1,
00060       flagbit = anumbit << 1,
00061       usr1bit = flagbit << 1,
00062       usr2bit = usr1bit << 1,
00063       usr3bit = usr2bit << 1
00064     };
00065 
00066     // Exception classes
00067     struct UnsetProperty : public std::exception {
00068       UnsetProperty() { message = "Attempting to access an unset atom property"; }
00069       UnsetProperty(const char* p) : message(p) { }
00070 
00071       virtual const char *what() const throw() {
00072         return(message);
00073       }
00074 
00075       const char* message;
00076     };
00077 
00078 
00079     Atom() { init(); }
00080 
00082 
00089     Atom(const int i, const std::string s, const GCoord& c) {
00090       init();
00091       _id = i;
00092       _name = s;
00093       _coords = c;
00094     }
00095 
00096 
00097     ~Atom() { }
00098 
00099     // Accessors...
00100     int id(void) const;
00101     void id(const int);
00102

00104     void resid(const int);

00107     void atomic_number(const int);

00110     void name(const std::string);
00111

00116     void chainId(const std::string);
00117 
00118     std::string resname(void) const;
00119     void resname(const std::string);
00120 
00121     std::string segid(void) const;
00122     void segid(const std::string);
00123 
00124     std::string iCode(void) const;
00125     void iCode(const std::string);
00126 
00127     std::string PDBelement(void) const;
00128     void PDBelement(const std::string);

00226

00228     void init(void);

00239     int _resid;
00240     int _atomic_number;

00242     double _b, _q, _charge, _mass;
00243     std::string _segid, _pdbelement;
00244     GCoord _coords;
00245     unsigned long mask;
00246 
00247     std::vector<int> bonds;
00248   };

00253   struct AtomEquals : public std::binary_function<pAtom, pAtom, bool> {
00254     bool operator()(const pAtom& a, const pAtom& b) const;
00255   };
00256

00259 
00262   struct AtomCoordsEquals : public std::binary_function<pAtom, pAtom, bool> {
00263     AtomCoordsEquals(const double d) : threshold(d*d) { }
00264     AtomCoordsEquals() : threshold(1e-6) { }
00265 
00266     bool operator()(const pAtom& a, const pAtom& b) const;
00267     double threshold;
00268   };
